articles.title: Mongolian President Arrives Here
articles.content:
Mongolian President Arrives Here
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj arrived here by a special plane on Monday at the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
					 He was accompanied by his wife, Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, secretary general of the National Security Council, Tserendejid Byambajav, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, Khabshai Erjan, vice-minister of Road Transport, Lundeg Purevsuren, National Security and Foreign Policy Advisor to the President, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, advisor for mass liaison and mass policy to the President, Pureb Altangerel, secretary of state for the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, and other suite members.
					
					 They were greeted by Kim Yong Nam, Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, O Kum Chol, vice-chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Son Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Kwak Il Ryong, vice-minister of Land and Maritime Transport, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Kim Jin Bom who is chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 Present at the airport were Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials and diplomatic envoys of different countries.
					
					 A welcome ceremony took place at the airport for the Mongolian president.
					
					 The president together with Kim Yong Nam reviewed the guards of honor of the Ground Force, Navy and Air and Anti-Air Force of the Korean People's Army and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards.
					
					 Korean women workers and children of the Mongolian embassy here presented bouquets to the president and his wife.

articles.title: Talks between Kim Yong Nam, Mongolian President Held
articles.content:
Talks between Kim Yong Nam, Mongolian President Held
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Talks between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kwak Il Ryong, vice-minister of Land and Maritime Transport, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, and officials concerned.
					
					 Present from the Mongolian side were Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, secretary general of the National Security Council, Tserendejid Byambajav, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, Khabshai Erjan, vice-minister of Road Transport, Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the President, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, advisor for mass liaison and mass policy to the President, Pureb Altangerel, secretary of state for the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, and officials concerned.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the bilateral relations of friendship and other issues of mutual concern.
					
					 The talks took place in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Agreements on Cooperation between Governments of DPRK, Mongolia Signed
articles.content:
Agreements on Cooperation between Governments of DPRK, Mongolia Signed
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in the fields of industry and agriculture and an agreement on cooperation in the fields of culture, sports and tourism were signed here on Monday between the governments of the DPRK and Mongolia.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kwak Il Ryong, vice-minister of Land and Maritime Transport, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, Jong Song Chan, vice general director of the General Bureau of Software Industry of the DPRK, and officials concerned.
					
					 Present from the Mongolian side were Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, secretary general of the National Security Council, Tserendejid Byambajav, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, Khabshai Erjan, vice-minister of Road Transport, Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the President, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, advisor for mass liaison and mass policy to the President, Pureb Altangerel, secretary of state for the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, officials concerned and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.
					
					 The agreement on cooperation in the fields of industry and agriculture was inked by Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, and Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, and the agreement on cooperation in the fields of culture, sports and tourism by Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, on behalf of the governments of the DPRK and Mongolia.
					
					 Meanwhile, the 2013-2015 plan for exchange in the IT field between the General Bureau of Software Industry of the DPRK and the IT, Post and Telecommunication Bureau of Mongolia was signed.

articles.title: Banquet Given for Mongolian President
articles.content:
Banquet Given for Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) hosted a banquet in honor of Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj on a state visit to the DPRK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday evening.
					 Present there on invitation were the president and his wife, Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, secretary general of the National Security Council, Tserendejid Byambajav, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, Khabshai Erjan, vice-minister of Road Transport, Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the President, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, advisor for mass liaison and mass policy to the President, Pureb Altangerel, secretary of state for the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, and personages concerned and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK SPA, Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, O Kum Chol, vice-chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kwak Il Ryong, vice-minister of Land and Maritime Transport, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Kim Jin Bom who is chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam made a speech there.
					
					 He said that this is a significant year marking the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries and the 25th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's second visit to Mongolia.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Mongolian president's visit to the DPRK marks an important occasion in boosting the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries, which were provided and developed by the preceding leaders, as required by the new era. The exchange of delegations at various levels and visits have become brisk in various fields including politics, economy, military affairs and sports and support and cooperation in the international arena have grown stronger than ever before.
					
					 We rejoice as our own over the fact that the friendly government and people of Mongolia have achieved the rapid socio-economic development of the country and raised the international position of their country by pursuing an independent and multi-faceted foreign policy under the leadership of the president. And we sincerely hope that everything will go well in Mongolia in the days to come.
					
					 We will as ever make all efforts to positively develop the friendly and cooperative relations with Mongolia having a long history and tradition.
					
					 Mongolian President H.E. Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj spoke next.
					
					 He said that he was pleased that the official talks between the two countries were held in a candid and friendly atmosphere and consensus was reached on all issues discussed at the talks.
					
					 He expressed belief that all issues agreed upon between the two countries would make a substantial contribution to enriching the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation in new areas and positively developing them in the mutual interests.
					
					 The Mongolian people are pleased that the preceding leaders of state and government of Mongolia and His Excellency Kim Il Sung and His Excellency Kim Jong Il, great leaders of Korean people, laid the cornerstone of traditional friendly relations between Mongolia and the DPRK and the bilateral cooperation is steadily improving in the fields of politics, economy, culture and humanitarianism, he said and went on:
					
					 I am sure that the Korean people will successfully achieve prosperity and progress of the country, their happiness and regional peace and stability in close cooperation with the international community.
					
					 I wish the hard-working Korean people greater successes in carrying out the cause of peaceful reunification of the country and its prosperity under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The banquet proceeded in an atmosphere overflowing with friendly sentiments.

articles.title: Art Performance Given in Welcome of Mongolian President
articles.content:
Art Performance Given in Welcome of Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A music and dance performance was given by the Mansudae Art Troupe at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Monday in honor of Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.
					 Present there on invitation were the Mongolian president and his suite members and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, officials concerned and people in the city.
					
					 The performance began with prologue "Fortune of Korea". Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as mixed duet and chorus "Our Leader Loved by the People" and female solo and chorus "Ardent Desire".
					
					 The performers represented the boundless reverence of the army and people for Marshal Kim Jong Un who is carving out a bright future of Korea.
					
					 Mongolian songs of male solo "Remember My Mother" and female solo "I Love Mongolia" pleased the Mongolian guests as they depicted patriotism and feeling of the Mongolian people.
					
					 A floral basket in the name of the Mongolian president was delivered to the performers in congratulation of their successful performance.

articles.title: Participants in KPA Meeting Vow to Turn All Companies into Elite Combat Units
articles.content:
Participants in KPA Meeting Vow to Turn All Companies into Elite Combat Units 
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A rally was held at the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Monday to pay high tribute to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and thoroughly implement the important tasks set forth by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un in his historic speech made at the 4th meeting of company commanders and political instructors of the Korean People's Army.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Chang Sop and other senior officials of the armed forces organs and KPA commanding officers.
					
					 KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, made a speech.
					
					 He vowed to turn all companies of the KPA into elite combat units devotedly defending the supreme commander.
					
					 All service personnel of the KPA are watching with vigilance the reckless moves of the enemies to stifle the DPRK militarily and all companies will go into action at a breath and blow up all the bases for aggression with merciless deadly strikes if the supreme commander issues an order, he declared.
					
					 Then, company commanders and political instructors spoke evincing their resolutions on behalf of the KPA Ground Force, Navy and Air and Anti-Air Force.
					
					 Company Commander Ham Yong Bong pledged to train soldiers in simulated conditions of a real war, prepare them to be a-match-for-a-hundred fighters and make his company a tiger company blowing up bases for aggression before any other companies once a fight breaks out.
					
					 Company Political Instructor Pak Hyon Su said that all the sailors would become human torpedoes and send aggressors to the bottom of sea if they intrude into the inviolable territorial waters of the DPRK even a bit.
					
					 Company Commander Ri Chol Ho declared that airmen would keep themselves highly alerted and intensify flight training as required by the prevailing situation and wipe out enemies with Korean style powerful strike means once the supreme commander issues an order.

articles.title: DPRK Delegate Re-clarifies Its Will to Continue Launching Application Satellites
articles.content:
DPRK Delegate Re-clarifies Its Will to Continue Launching Application Satellites 
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegate speaking at the meeting of the Fourth Committee of the 68th UN General Assembly on Oct. 23 re-clarified the will of the DPRK to continue launching application satellites for the development of the nation's economy and the improvement of the people's living standard.
					 The delegate in a speech made during the discussion on the agenda item "International Cooperation in Peaceful Use of Outer Space" appreciated the efforts of the UN Office for Outer Space Affairs and the committee for the development and application of space science and technology in all countries and for the increase of the capabilities of developing countries to explore space, in particular.
					
					 The DPRK is also directing efforts to developing space for peaceful purposes in keeping with the worldwide trend of space exploration, he said, referring to a series of measures taken by the DPRK government to intensify the work for space development while launching satellites several times.
					
					 He went on to say: The DPRK's exploration of space is an exercise of legitimate independent right by a sovereignty state. It is publicly recognized by international law and inviolable.
					
					 Nevertheless, the hostile forces unreasonably claim that the DPRK is not allowed to launch satellites even for peaceful purposes, though other countries do.
					
					 The U.S. and some other countries disallow those countries incurring their displeasure to launch satellites for peaceful purposes while shutting their eyes to the launch of satellites or inter-continental ballistic missiles by those countries subservient to them. This is the reality today.
					
					 The DPRK categorically rejects the "resolutions on sanctions" adopted at the UN Security Council against the DPRK over its launch of satellites for peaceful purposes and re-clarifies that it will continue launching application satellites for the development of the nation's economy and improvement of the people's living standard in the future, too, ensuring transparency by going through procedures of international law.
					
					 The DPRK will, at the same time, fulfill its commitments by joining in the worldwide efforts for the active use of outer space as a wealth common to humankind.

articles.title: Congratulations to Norwegian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Norwegian PM
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Erna Solberg upon her appointment as prime minister of Norway.
					 The message wished her success in her responsible work for the stability and development of the country, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Monday sent a similar message to Borge Brende upon his appointment as foreign minister of Norway.

articles.title: Participants in KPA Meeting Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
Participants in KPA Meeting Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 4th meeting of company commanders and political instructors of the Korean People's Army (KPA) toured different parts of Pyongyang.
					 They visited the National Gifts Exhibition House.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to the full-length statues of smiling President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the general review hall.
					
					 They looked round the gifts which the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu received from the KPA and people, overseas compatriots and figures of all social standings in south Korea, being briefed on the fact that the exhibition house was successfully built as a treasure house of eternal value for Kim Il Sung's nation.
					
					 They visited the KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment where they deeply grasped the exploits the peerlessly great men performed by establishing an independent and modern defence industry and turning the DPRK into an invincible military power and a full-fledged nuclear weapons state.
					
					 They also toured the Munsu Water Park and the Mirim Riding Club.
					
					 They were deeply moved to hear explanations about the indoor and outdoor wading pools and gymnasium with various types of water slides and water tanks and riding courses, riding training halls, room for dissemination of riding knowledge and others which were built in a peculiar style.
					
					 Touring popular service centers which have sprung up as wonderful edifices in the era of Songun thanks to the noble intention of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, they keenly realized that the happy laughter of people and the sound of horses hooves are ascribable to the care of the mother party which does not spare anything for the people.

Chinese Delegation Departs Here
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the All-China Journalists Association led by Liu Ying, director of the International Department of the Workers' Daily, flew back home on Monday.

articles.title: Delegation of Rodong Sinmun Leaves for China

Delegation of Rodong Sinmun Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Rodong Sinmun led by its Vice Editor-in-Chief Kim Won Sok left here Monday to visit China.

articles.title: Indian Embassy Officials Visit Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies
articles.content:
Indian Embassy Officials Visit Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Indian Ambassador to the DPRK Ajay Kumar Sharma and staff members of his embassy visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies on Monday on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and India.
					 Being briefed on the fact that the university has all conditions necessary for education and that talents have been schooled at the university, the guests looked round the room devoted to the history of the university and lecture rooms.
					
					 At the end of the visit the ambassador said that he wishes the university greater success in its education.
					
					 The guests donated teaching materials to the university.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful at Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful at Championship 
 Tehran, October 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestlers are proving successful at the 28th World Military Men's Wrestling Championship now under way in Iran.
					 Jong Hak Jin in the freestyle 55kg category event defeated his Iraqi rival by a fall in 1 min. and 30 sec. of the first round in the preliminary match and his Kazakh rival 7:0 in 59 sec. of the first round in semi-finals.
					
					 He trounced his Iranian rival 8:3 by displaying high technique in the finals on Saturday and bagged a gold medal.
					
					 Meanwhile, Yang Chun Song placed second in the freestyle 66kg category.
					
					 The championship continues.

articles.title: DPRK Go Player Proves Successful in Int'l Tournament
articles.content:
DPRK Go Player Proves Successful in Int'l Tournament
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK go player Jo Tae Won, 25, won the first place at the individuals in the 2013 "Business Trip Cup" International City Go Tournament held in Hangzhou, China some time ago. 
					 Participating in the tournament were dozens of players from at least 10 countries and regions, including the DPRK, China, Russia, Canada, Japan and the U.S. 
					
					 Among them were the twice world amateur champion and others who made good results in go tournaments. 
					
					 Jo made five rivals give up matches till the sixth round and beat a south Korean player at the seventh round and another rivals at the eighth and ninth rounds with fine moves, correct judgment and daring offensives.
					
					 He was awarded the cup of the tournament and its certificate. 
					
					 The head of the Chinese Go Association highly appreciated Jo for his fine go skill and mentality. 
					
					 It was the first time that the DPRK player took the first place in the annual go tournament started in 2001. 
					
					 Jo has recorded good results in international tournaments including the go event of the 1st World Intelligence Competition (2008).

articles.title: Men's Premier Soccer Matches End in DPRK
articles.content:
Men's Premier Soccer Matches End in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Men's premier soccer matches, which started on October 1 as part of the DPRK Championships, came to an end in Kim Il Sung Stadium on Sunday. 
					 The April 25 Team finished first in the matches, followed by Mangyongbong and Hwaebul teams.
					
					 Following are the results of men's premier soccer matches held on Saturday and Sunday.

					 The women's event will be finished on Tuesday.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has recently issued new stamps of diverse themes.
					 One of them contains a poster titled "Let Us Usher in a Fresh Heyday on All Fronts of Socialist Construction by Creating the 'Speed on Masik Pass'". The poster portrays a soldier-builder appealing to the people to effect a new upsurge in the socialist construction.
					
					 Other four stamps show children in striped jackets, women in chima (skirt) and jogori (coat), traditional Korean costumes, restaurant boat "Taedonggang" and cargo and refrigerator vessels built in the DPRK.

articles.title: Public Support for Sportspersons Increases in DPRK
articles.content:
Public Support for Sportspersons Increases in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Ministries and national institutions are taking the lead in supporting sportspersons in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with public interest in sports activities increasing in the country.
					 The Ministry of Construction and Building-Materials Industry gives positive support to the marathon event.
					
					 Officials of the ministry have paid regular visits to lodging quarters of players to help them devote themselves to training without any inconvenience.
					
					 The Korea National Insurance Corporation is one of those national institutions active in backing sportspersons.
					
					 In February last, officials of the corporation made a call at the Table-Tennis Gymnasium in Chongchun Street to acquaint themselves with the training of players and provided them with new training instruments, while taking care of their life. 
					
					 The General Bureau of Public Service is supporting the weightlifting event. Its officials take care of competent weightlifters each to look after their training and life as well as the life of their families.
					
					 The Pyongyang Poultry Farming Guidance Bureau, External Construction Guidance Bureau, Ministry of Oil Industry, Taesong Guidance Bureau and other ministries and national institutions have offered lots sports apparatuses and other necessities to sportspersons.

articles.title: Indoor Wading Pool in Munsu Water Park Enjoys Popularity
articles.content:
Indoor Wading Pool in Munsu Water Park Enjoys Popularity
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Munsu Water Park, newly built here, boasts of an indoor wading pool with two roofs of pyramid-shaped supported by ball trusses.
					 The two-storied pool keeps its temperature at 26-27℃ in all seasons.
					
					 On the first floor, it houses ten-odd water tanks, including a five-course swimming tank, a supersonic-wave tank, a surfing tank and a seawater tank.
					
					 What catches one's eyes is a tank designed for children, a frog-shaped slide, octopus and mushroom-shaped douches and a tank with amusement instruments.
					
					 Seen in the pool are different kinds of slides including tube slides.
					
					 There are also recessing places in a tunnel with its ceiling and wall featuring surging waves.
					
					 The indoor wading pool has oak charcoal, salt and ochre saunas, as well as shower places and ice and oxygen rooms.
					
					 Besides, it has public service facilities, fitness rooms, soft drink counters, restaurants and shops.

articles.title: Cemetery of CPV Fallen Fighters, Symbol of DPRK-China Friendship
articles.content:
Cemetery of CPV Fallen Fighters, Symbol of DPRK-China Friendship
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- In Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, there is the Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV), a symbol of the fraternal friendship between the peoples of the DPRK and China.
					 The cemetery enshrines remains of CPV fighters who fought to a heroic death against the allied imperialist forces in the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953).
					
					 A bust of Mao Anying, son of Mao Zedong, stands in the cemetery.
					
					 The cemetery consists of a gate, granite tombstones, memorial monument and wall paintings which picture CPV fighters and Koreans assisting them.
					
					 It was renovated in 2012. 
					
					 An increasing number of people are visiting the cemetery on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the entry of the CPV into the Korean front.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, visited the cemetery in July last year and said that the CPV fighters who lost their lives in the Korean war will remain in the memory of the DPRK servicepersons and people for all ages.

articles.title: Mongolian President's Visit to DPRK Welcomed
articles.content:
Mongolian President's Visit to DPRK Welcomed
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj is to arrive here Monday to pay a state visit to the DPRK at the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
					 Papers here Monday in their editorials warmly welcome the friendship envoy of the Mongolian people coming to the DPRK carrying with him the friendly feelings towards the Korean people.
					
					 The DPRK-Mongolia friendship has steadily developed with significant events recorded in its history, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung provided the fraternal relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries and peoples and made great contributions to boosting them.
					
					 This is a significant year marking the 25th anniversary of the second visit to Mongolia by the President and the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries. The two countries had joint significant celebrations of the anniversaries this year.
					
					 We are pleased that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Mongolia with a long history and tradition have favorably developed in various fields in recent years.
					
					 The Korean people will as ever make all efforts to boost these relations with the Mongolian people.
					
					 Minju Joson says the Korean people sincerely hope that the friendship envoys of Mongolia will make the current visit to the DPRK fruitful and spend happy and pleasant days here.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Hits out at Park Geun Hye's "Confidence-building Process"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Hits out at Park Geun Hye's "Confidence-building Process"
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The hypocritical nature of the "confidence-building process on the Korean Peninsula", south Korean puppet president Park Geun Hye's "policy toward the north", was brought to light in just a few months.
					 Park talked about following "the third way" of improving the north-south relations based on "confidence" and giving priority to "confidence-building" and dialogue in adhering to the "principle of separation of  politics from economy" before and after taking her office but these words disappeared and only reckless remarks inciting distrust and confrontation are heard from her.
					
					 She has gone beyond the phase of uttering such negative words as "disallowance of the north's nukes" and "adherence to principle" but gone the lengths of talking a lot about such dangerous theory of war as "preempting a nuclear strike at the north" and "leading the north to changes" and the "theory of bringing down its social system".
					
					 Park's "confidence-building process" which sounds like a foreign phraseology is no more than a theory of distrust and confrontation as it is of treacherous and anti-reunification nature in all aspects from its origin to its ultimate goal.
					
					 It is rooted in the "Helsinki process" worked out by the U.S. and other Western forces in a bid to bring down the socialist system in East European countries in the last century.
					
					 Had Park been truly concerned about the issue of the nation and reunification, she wouldn't have been carried away by something foreign, her master's work, but would have commenced her job on the basis of the good precedent recorded in the history of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The two north-south summits and joint declarations specially recorded in the history of the nation serve as good experience as they made a breakthrough in the history of distrust and confrontation and ushered in a new era of unity, reunification and peace and prosperity.
					
					 If she thoroughly implemented the historic declarations based on the idea of "By our nation itself", without using the word "confidence," this would precisely mean the process of confidence-building between the north and the south and the one of achieving unity and reunification.
					
					 Park tried hard to conceal her true colors by wearing a veil of "confidence", claiming that she was "different" from traitor Lee Myung Bak. However, this only revealed the roots of distrust and enmity lurking behind it.
					
					 A saying goes that a poisonous herb has its own noxious root. What Park and her "confidence-building process" have shown for the past 8 months are only distrust and confrontation.
					
					 No sooner had Park taken office than she cried out for "resolute joint counter-action of south Korea and the U.S. against the north's provocation", asserting that the above-said "process" is "by no means an appeasement policy" and "it is based on military deterrence through south Korea-U.S. alliance".
					
					 She uttered that "the north's dismantlement of nukes was not a precondition" but is now taking the lead in the nuclear racket against the DPRK after declaring her policy "urging the north to dismantle its nukes first." 
					
					 Not only her U.S. master's moves to stifle the DPRK but also provocative hysteria of the war maniacs of the south Korean puppet army are to be "absolutely trusted" and such behaviors deliberately going beyond the tolerance limit any time are tolerated.
					
					 On the contrary, the joint declarations which should be regarded as cornerstones for the development of the north-south relations have been totally denied and actions demanding their implementation have become targets of distrust and suppression.
					
					 When the south Korean puppet Intelligence Service recklessly opened to public the minutes of north-south summit on June 24 just 4 months after Park took office, people from various circles in south Korea reacted against it at once.
					
					 "Now that the minutes of the south-north summit, the core of the confidence-building on the Korean Peninsula, are opened to public, how can inter-Korean dialogue be conducted in an honest and candid manner? It is our view that inter-Korean relations in the 5 years of the Park's government have collapsed." "The opening of the minutes of south-north summit is an unprecedented one. It brought to light that the process is not for trust but for confrontation."
					
					 This is the conclusion drawn by the Korean nation and the judgment made by history of Park Geun Hye and her "north policy".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Revive Fascist Dictatorship
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Revive Fascist Dictatorship
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The moves to revive fascist dictatorship in south Korea are the desperate efforts of the old forces to dampen the desire of the people for democratic development of society and  stem the trend of history and bring back the past era, observes Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article. 
					 The present south Korean puppet regime openly embellished the crime-woven past even before coming to power and is now getting more frantic with the moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorship after taking office, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The fascist dictatorship is a typical ruling method of the old forces which had been thrown to fringes of history, forsaken by the people. 
					
					 The desperate efforts of the puppet conservative forces to strengthen the repressive rule only indicate that the ruin of the old forces is coming nearer. 
					
					 The moves to revive the "Yusin" dictatorship are inhuman criminal acts to brutally trample down the people's independent rights. 
					
					 It is natural that the people's desire for independent life and dignity grows stronger as history develops and the era advances. 
					
					 The south Korean people, in particular, are stronger in their desire for genuine life and rights as their independent desire and life are mercilessly trampled down under the colonial domination of the outside forces and fascist rule of the country-selling rulers. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities often vociferate about "human rights" and "people's living." However, it is nothing but sophism to cover up their true colors as the fascist junta wantonly violating democracy and human rights. 
					
					 Their moves to revive the "Yusin" dictatorship are as foolish acts as precipitating their self-destruction. 
					
					 The puppet ruling quarters should know that the fascist dictatorship is by no means an almighty means.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Disregarding Even    International Body
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Disregarding Even International Body
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The first director general of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) recently denounced the U.S. for ousting him from his office in order to secure justification for invasion of Iraq -- "elimination of WMD".
					 Rodong Sinmun on Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This goes to prove that the U.S. is the burglar without an equal who behaves as it pleases, disregarding the publicly recognized international law and body for achieving its aggressive purposes.
					
					 The assertion of the U.S. that Iraq had WMD was no more than an excuse for starting a war against it.
					
					 The U.S. cooks up an excuse for aggression at any moment if it deems necessary.
					
					 It is putting unreasonable pressure upon other countries or taking international sanctions against them under the pretext of halting the production of WMD.
					
					 The U.S. is the biggest possessor of WMDs in the world. It is none other than the U.S. which is spreading WMDs and unhesitatingly using them in wars of aggression against mankind.
					
					 It is quite ridiculous for the U.S. to advocate "world without nuclear weapons" as it is making no scruple of perpetrating invasion of sovereign states, disregarding the UN Charter and international law.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. cover its true colors as the arch criminal who uses WMDs for attaining its purpose of aggression and domination without hesitation and the mastermind of spread of those weapons, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Group's Moves to Stamp out Progressive Forces under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Group's Moves to Stamp out Progressive Forces under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The coteries of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea are working hard to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party by labeling it as a political party "following the north." They let loose sophism that the party is "negating the nature of the system and sympathizing with the north" and "it is a political party founded at the instruction of the north".
					 The puppet Ministry of Justice of south Korea also set up the "committee for examining unconstitutional political parties and organizations" and is trying hard to formally bring to the "Constitutional Court" the issue of dissolving the Unified Progressive Party.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is hideous politically-motivated terrorism intended to outlaw the activities of the Unified Progressive Party, turn the whole of south Korea into fascist mayhem and a society dominated by ultra-right conservative forces. 
					
					 Disclosing the aims sought by the puppet forces in working with blood-shot eyes to stamp out the progressive forces including the Unified Progressive Party, the commentary notes: 
					
					 Truth about the "case of the Intelligence Service's interference in the presidential election" is now being brought to light and people's criticism is now growing stronger in south Korea. 
					
					 Confrontation and conflict between the ruling and opposition parties are inching close to explosion as the puppet authorities' base moves to conceal the truth about the case are being brought to light.
					
					 It is against this backdrop that the puppet group is keen to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party. This is nothing but a political ploy to divert elsewhere the attention of public opinion focused on the group and suppress the resistance of the opposition forces in a bid to tide over the crisis and bring the political situation under control. 
					
					 The group is sadly mistaken if it thinks it can weather the ruling crisis by resorting to fascist intrigues and repressive campaign.
					
					 This will, however, only bring into bolder relief its fascist and anti- reunification nature. What is awaiting the group is only curses and denunciation at home and abroad and a stern judgment of history.

articles.title: Actions against Suppression of Jongyojo Declared
articles.content:
Actions against Suppression of Jongyojo Declared
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting in Seoul on October 24 to declare that it would struggle against the suppression of the Teachers Union (Jongyojo).

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities Accused of Suppressing Progressive Media
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities Accused of Suppressing Progressive Media
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Yang Un Sik, permanent chairman of the U.S. Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, released a statement on October 23 accusing the south Korean puppet authorities of scheming to shut down a progressive internet medium.
					 The statement slammed the Seoul City Office for contemplating holding a public hearing in a sinister purpose to close the south Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo calling for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 This is a blatant challenge to pro-reunification patriotic forces, it charged, adding:
					
					 Jaju Minbo has objectively reported facts about the north. It was to check the deterioration of north-south relations and to help the south Koreans know better about the north.
					
					 Just are the activities of the paper as it has worked for the reunification of the country, desirous of achieving co-prosperity of the nation by implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 Much upset by the increasing influence of the paper, the Park Geun Hye's "government" is brandishing a dagger to crack down the progressive medium. This is intolerable.
					
					 We will actively conduct a mass campaign to check its move to close Jaju Minbo.

articles.title: S. Korean Political Camp in Confusion
articles.content:
S. Korean Political Camp in Confusion
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean political situation has been thrown into the mire of confusion over the case of the puppet Intelligence Service's (IS) interference in the election.
					 Factual data revealing that agents of the IS employed red herrings to ensure the win of the candidate from the "Saenuri Party" during the "presidential election" last year are being disclosed one after another, adding fuel to the scramble between the ruling party and the opposition one.
					
					 The opposition Democratic Party disclosed that personnel of the group for psychological warfare of the IS conducted red herring operations for more than 55 000 times to support the candidate from the ruling party and slander the candidate from the opposition party, adding such an expression as "control of election" is more appropriate than "interference in election" as regards the above-said election rigging.
					
					 Lawmakers in the Legislation and Judiciary Committee of the "National Assembly" from the Democratic Party opened to public the data submitted to the Court by the special investigation group for probing the truth behind the IS's interference in the election. They said the data go to prove that the IS played a role as an election team for candidate Park Geun Hye during the "presidential election".
					
					 Much upset by it, the "Saenuri Party" pretended ignorance, saying "it is not a fact", "it has no legal validity as it was illegally obtained" and the like.
					
					 Yun Sok Yol who led the special investigation team testified to the fact that the Park Geun Hye group put pressure on him in a bid to cover up the crimes of the IS. As a result, the conflict between the ruling party and the opposition one festered.
					
					 Present as a witness at the state inspection at the Legislation and Judiciary Committee of the "National Assembly", he said when he visited Jo Yong Gon, chief of the Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office, on October 15 to report to him the operations to arrest and search personnel of the IS who conducted red herring operations and the future plan for investigation, Jo got very angry and objected to it, querying is it necessary to tip scale in favor of the opposition party.
					
					 Yun was excluded from the special investigation team under pressure of the authorities.
					
					 Lawmakers from opposition parties including the Democratic Party are strongly reacting to it, saying lurking behind Yun's exclusion from the special investigation team is the intention of the Park Geun Hye's "government" to bring the prosecution under its control and save the IS by killing it. Asserting the "presidential election" was, in a nutshell, a fraudulent one, they urged Park to make an apology and the minister of Justice, the director of the IS and the chief of the Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office to step down.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" is trying hard to ward off the opposition parties' criticism and conceal the truth about the case at any cost, claiming the Democratic Party is seeking revenge for its failure in the election through a political offensive.
					
					 The south Korean political camp is, however, finding itself in greater mayhem in the wake of the disclosure of the fact that the Ministry of Justice urged the special investigation team to downplay the investigation as regards the case of the IS's interference in the election.

articles.title: S. Korean Lawmaker Accuses Puppet Patriots and Veterans Affairs Agency of Inciting Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Lawmaker Accuses Puppet Patriots and Veterans Affairs Agency of Inciting Confrontation 
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the puppet Patriots and Veterans Affairs Agency of south Korea instilled confrontation with fellow countrymen into students and public workers. 
					 A lawmaker from the opposition Democratic Party disclosed this on Oct. 24. 
					
					 According to him, the institute for educating students in patriots and veterans affairs under the Agency produced a collection of misinformation about the DPRK. 
					
					 The collection labels the regimes during which the north-south joint declarations were adopted "leftist ones following the north" and the opposition parties "pro-north ones" and calls for preventing the emergence of the "pro-north government" at any cost. 
					
					 The above-said Agency persistently instilled such confrontation into schoolchildren, students and public workers through special lectures given by use of such collection as textbook from the last year till the August this year. 
					
					 This fact proves that not only the Intelligence Service and the Defense Ministry but also the above-said Agency backed the conservative group by illegally interfering in the election.

articles.title: Revival of "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea Intolerable: DFRK
articles.content:
Revival of "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea Intolerable: DFRK
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea (DFRK) Monday issued an indictment laying bare the gravity and danger of the moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorship in south Korea, the fascist dark era.
					 According to the indictment, Park Chung-Hee, the ill-famed "yusin" dictator, seized "power" through a military coup and established the one-man dictatorial system unprecedented in south Korea before exercising unlimited power.
					
					 The present chief executive of south Korea took office and established the one-person ruling system reminiscent of the "yusin" dictatorial system. She broke a promise to enforce the systems whereby "the prime minister assumes responsibility" and "ministers own responsibility" and set up a direct ruling system under Chongwadae so that it may control all domestic and foreign policies and even "the policy toward the north". She thus reduced the puppet prime minister and ministries and agencies under the administration into puppets.
					
					 She is reorganizing power mechanisms in the "yusin" dictatorship-style or totally reviving the ruling machines during the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 The "National Security Office" of Chongwadae which is reported to handle all diplomacy, security and unification matters is a copy of the "National Security Council" made by Park Chung-Hee in 1963. The puppet Intelligence Service has become a machine going above law just as the Central Intelligence Agency did under the "yusin regime."
					
					 Many "yusin" remnants and their descendants are holding "government" posts. 
					
					 The revival of the "yusin" dictatorship in south Korea finds a vivid manifestation in embellishing the "yusin" dictatorship of Park Chung-Hee and reviving things dating back to those times.
					
					 "Memorial services" took place in Seoul and in Kumi, North Kyongsang Province, the birthplace of Park Chung-Hee, on October 26, the 34th anniversary of the death of the "yusin" dictatorship. Not content with whitewashing the "yusin" at the services, the puppet conservative group including the "Saenuri Party" praised the May 16 military coup as a "decisive action for national salvation" and traitor Park Chung-Hee, the "yusin" dictator, as a "great man".
					
					 Son Pyong Du, director general of the "Park Chung-Hee's Memorial Foundation", blustered that he would certainly build together with Park Geun Hye what Park Chung-Hee wanted to achieve and the "yusin" era is better, sparking off public uproar.
					
					 Even the "Park Chung-Hee leadership ability research institute" is now operating in south Korea.
					
					 Park Geun Hye is claiming that she would develop the "new village movement" conducted by Park Chung-Hee in the 1970s into a "future-oriented movement for reforming citizens' consciousness" and an "all-people movement".
					
					  In August last the Committee for Compiling National History examined and passed the history textbooks rewritten by the Association of Contemporary History, an ultra-right conservative organization, seriously distorting the modern history of south Korea including the embellishment of the Park Chung Hee's "yusin" dictatorial rule, and let all the high schools use the textbooks from March next year.
					
					 The revival of "yusin" dictatorship finds its clear expression in the south Korean regime's fascist suppression of people of various circles.
					
					 After Park Geun Hye's seizure of power, a terror-ridden atmosphere of suppression racket reminiscent of the "yusin" dictatorship is prevailing in south Korea.
					
					 It is against the backdrop of reign of intelligence-based politics and repressive politics that activities of political parties and organizations have been brutally suppressed, elementary political freedom, democratic rights and rights of south Korean people wantonly violated.
					
					 The south Korean regime kicked up a whirlwind of arrest, grumbling that the South Headquarters of Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) is still active though it is long since it was labeled an "organization benefiting enemy". It is suppressing such core members of the headquarters as the acting chairman, secretary general and director in charge of cooperation with foreign countries of Pomminryon after detaining them.
					
					 Park is zealously encouraging the repressive forces in the suppression of the Teachers Union after branding it as "a blight-like organization" and "the main culprit plunging schools into state of confusion".
					
					 After Park took office the puppet conservative group put 103 personages behind bars on the charge of violation of the "Security Law", much more than the number of those detained in the same period last year.
					
					 The revival of "yusin" dictatorship is seriously affecting the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The conservative group is now driving the inter-Korean relations into a catastrophe, trumpeting about "confrontation accompanied by dialogue" and "confrontation of the social systems" just as the erstwhile "yusin regime" did.
					
					 Absolutely intolerable is the revival of the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 If Park Geun Hye persists in reviving the "yusin" dictatorship in disregard of the warnings of the history and the nation, she will never escape the same miserable fate as that her father's "yusin" dictatorship met.

articles.title: 10,000-strong Candlelight Action Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
10,000-strong Candlelight Action Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- An all-people candlelight meeting took place Saturday at the plaza of Seoul Railway Station in demand of the probe into the truth behind the illegal interference of the Intelligence Service (IS) in the election. 
					 Present at the meeting were more than 10,000 people including members of the civic and public organizations and labor movement organizations such as the Emergency Situation Council to Denounce IS Interference in Presidential Election for Political Operation, Solidarity for Progress, Teachers Union and Freight Workers' Solidarity. 
					
					 Speeches were made there. 
					
					 Pak Sok Un, co-representative of the emergency situation council, said that the Park Geun Hye regime openly blocks investigation into the case of the illegal interference in the election. 
					
					 Typical expression of it is pressing Chae Tong Uk to resign his post as "Public Prosecutor General" and excluding Yun Sok Yol from the special investigation team, he said, adding: 
					
					 All the moves are to cover up the truth behind the interference in the election. 
					
					 Park Geun Hye is behind the power organ's interference in the election. The unjust power will surely end up in ruin as dictator Park Chung-Hee met a miserable end 34 years ago. 
					
					 Ri Thae Ho, secretary general of the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, called for introducing a special investigation for probing into truth behind the interference in the election and disclosing the power organ's interference and Park Geun Hye's plot to cover up the case. 
					
					 Pak Ju Min, secretary general of the Bar Association for Democratic Society, stressed the need to surely punish those related to the unprecedented crime. 
					
					 Ri Yong Ju, senior vice-chairman of the Teachers Union, said that the Park Geun Hye regime has gone frantic in its moves to kill Teachers Union. The Teachers Union will receive not only discharged teachers but also all citizens supporting the union as unionists, he declared. 
					
					 Sin Sung Chol, chairman of the Confederation of Trade Unions, said that workers are laid off in different places and trade unions including the Teachers Union are oppressed by the "government". The Park Geun Hye regime disregarding the people will face severe punishment, Sin added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" was published in booklet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on October 22.
					 The work, made public on July 26, Juche 85 (1996), clarifies the idea that the Juche philosophy is an original one which evolved and systemized its inherent principles and a revolutionary and popular one which truly serves the purpose of the struggle for the independence of the popular masses.
					
					 It also indicates tasks to be fulfilled to study, explain and disseminate the Juche philosophy as intended the Workers' Party of Korea and thoroughly apply it to revolutionary practice.

articles.title: Anniversary of DIU Marked by British Organizations
articles.content:
Anniversary of DIU Marked by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Oct. 14 to mark the 87th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 The statement said:
					
					 The formation of the DIU 87 years ago was an epoch-making event in the Korean people's struggle to found a revolutionary party of the working class which broke with factionalism and flunkeyism.
					
					 Thanks to the formation of the DIU by President Kim Il Sung the Korean revolution could advance along its right path and there began  a new era of history in which the popular masses became masters of their destiny.
					
					 Its formation was a historical declaration of a new start of the Korean revolution and the glorious Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) began striking its roots from the DIU.
					
					 The programme of the DIU is being successfully implemented by the WPK.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into an invincible revolutionary party.
					
					 The WPK is carrying forward the tradition of the DIU, holding high the great banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Only victory and glory are in store for the WPK and the Korean people as they are led by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia funcion de unidades ganadoras del 36o festival artistico de militares
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia funcion de unidades ganadoras del 36o festival artistico de militares
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, vio la funcion de las companias adscritas a las unidades 251, 905, 565 y 1821 del EPC y del submarino 730 de la unidad 167 de las fuerzas navales del EPC que resultaron ganadores en el 36o Festival Artistico de Militares del EPC. 
					Los ejecutantes uniformados presentaron en la escena la narracion y cancion "Los grandes hombres del monte Paektu y soldados del islote Cho", la poesia en dialogo y cancion "Seguiremos con la unica alma", el coro "Quien se encarga de nuestro destino y futuro" y otras piezas.
					
					A traves del espectaculo, ellos describieron su feliz y digna vida de servicio militar que llevan en el regazo del Comandante Supremo, la gran anoranza a el y el poderio de la unidad monolitica en torno a el. 
					
					Tambien demostraron el aspecto orgulloso de si mismos que derraman mucho sudor en los ejercicios marcando con el corazon los pasos con el Comandante Supremo. 
					
					Terminada la funcion, el Mariscal respondio cordialmente con su mano alzada a las aclamaciones de ejecutantes. 
					
					Muy satisfecho de la excelente funcion signada de fuerte caracter politico y espiritu revolucionario de los militares, les expreso agradecimiento en nombre del Comandante Supremo. 
					
					Aprecio que los ejecutantes pusieron en la escena las piezas que dan respuestas a la pregunta de cuales son el caracter, la mision y la naturaleza revolucionaria de nuestro ejercito del partido y describieron el aspecto de si mismos que se esfuerzan mucho por fortalecer la compania, celula del ejercito y unidad principal de combate. 
					
					Se fotografio junto a los militares que demostraron patentemente los rasgos ideo-espirituales del EPC en el 36o Festival Artistico de Militares del EPC, expresando la esperanza y conviccion de que ellos registraran en lo adelante meritos mas grandes en el entrenamiento y el servicio militar. 
					
					Hay que seguir prestando gran atencion a las actividades de grupos artisticos de companias para preparar firmemente a los militares en lo ideo-politico y en lo tecnico-militar y como revolucionarios con ricos conocimientos de cultura, dijo e indico las tareas para el respecto. 
					
					El Comandante Supremo fue acompanado en esta ocasion por Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Kim Chang Sop, Pyon In Son, So Hong Chan, Kim Su Gil, Ryom Chol Song, Kim Yong Chol, Jo Kyong Chol, Hwang Pyong So y los participantes ejemplares en la 4a Conferencia de Jefes e Instructores Politicos de Companias del EPC.

articles.title: En Pyongyang presidente mongol Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj
articles.content:
En Pyongyang presidente mongol Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj 
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, llego el dia 28 a esta capital por avion especial para visitar la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cumplimentando la invitacion del presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam.

articles.content:

Presidium de la APS ofrece banquete en honor de Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 28 por la noche en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae una recepcion en honor de Su Excelencia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, presidente de Mongolia, de visita en la RPDC. 
					Fueron invitados junto con el mandatario mongol su esposa, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio, Luvsanvandan Bold, el embajador mongol en Corea Manibadrakh Ganbold, el ministro de Industria y Agricultura, Khaltmaa Battulga, el secretario del Consejo de Seguridad Nacional, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, el jefe del Estado Mayor General de las Fuerzas Armadas, Tserendejid Byambajav, el viceministro de Transporte, Khabshai Erjan, el asesor del presidente para la Seguridad Nacional y la Politica Exterior, Lundeg Purevsuren, el asesor del presidente para el enlace con masas y la politica para masas, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, el secretario de Estado del Ministerio de Cultura, Deportes y Turismo, Pureb Altangerel, y otras personalidades relacionadas, y los miembros de la embajada mongolena en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes el presidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el ministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Ryong Nam, el ministro de Deportes, Ri Jong Mu, la presidenta del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jong Suk, el subjefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, O Kum Chol, el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon, el viceministro de Transporte Terrestre y Maritimo, Kwak Il Ryong, el embajador coreano en Mongolia, Hong Kyu, el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y titular de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Mongolia, Kim Jin Bom, y otros funcionarios. 
					
					En la ocasion Kim Yong Nam pronuncio un discurso.
					
					El dijo que este ano significativo se cumplen el 65o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre los dos paises y el 25o aniversario de la segunda visita del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung a Mongolia.
					
					La presente visita del mandatario mongol a Corea marca un hito importante para desarrollar mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de los dos paises, preparadas y consolidadas por los lideres antecesores, de acuerdo con las demandas de la nueva epoca, apunto.
					
					Se refirio a que se activan el intercambio y las visitas de las delegaciones a todos los niveles en varios dominios como la politica, la economia, los asuntos militares y los deportes y se estrechan mas que nunca la colaboracion y la ayuda entre ambas partes en la palestra internacional. 
					
					Estamos regocijados de que bajo la guia del estimado Su Excelencia Presidente, el amistoso gobierno y pueblo de Mongolia logren vertiginoso desarrollo socioeconomico del pais y eleven la posicion internacional practicando la politica exterior independiente y multilateral y deseamos de todo corazon que en lo adelante tambien, todo vaya bien en Mongolia, dijo. 
					
					Expuso la voluntad de hacer todo lo posible por desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de larga historia y tradiciones con Mongolia. 
					
					Le siguio en usar la palabra Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj. 
					
					Complacido de que las conversaciones oficiales de hoy se realizaron en un ambiente sincero y amistoso y que ambas partes llegaron de acuerdo en todos los debates, expuso la conviccion de que todos los acuerdos haran una contribucion real a enriquecer en una nueva etapa las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y a desarrollarlas conforme a los intereses mutuos. 
					
					Dijo que el pueblo mongol esta regocijado de que los lideres antecesores de Mongolia y el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, grandes lideres del pueblo coreano, prepararon la base de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre Mongolia y la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y que esos vinculos se desarrollan incesantemente en los dominios de la politica, la economia, la cultura y el humanitarismo. 
					
					Deseo que el pueblo coreano logre exitos en lograr la prosperidad y desarrollo del pais, la felicidad del pueblo, la paz y estabilidad de la region en estrecha colaboracion con la sociedad internacional. 
					
					Manifesto la esperanza de que bajo la orientacion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el diligente pueblo coreano alcance mayores exitos en el cumplimiento de la causa por la reunificacion pacifica de la patria y por la prosperidad del pais. 
					
					El banquete transcurrio en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Tiene lugar funcion de musica y danza para Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj
articles.content:
Tiene lugar funcion de musica y danza para Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang Este la funcion de musica y danza del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae para dar bienvenida al presidente de Mongolia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.
					Fueron invitados la comitiva del mandatario visitante esposa y los miembros de la embajada mongolesa en Corea.
					
					Vieron la funcion el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, y otros funcionarios, asi como trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					En la funcion iniciada con el preludio "Fortuna de Corea" se presentaron el duo mixto y coro "Nuestro dirigente adorado por el pueblo", el solo femenino y coro  "Gran deseo" y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes describieron de modo emocionante la ardiente veneracion del ejercito y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hacia el Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien abre el raiante futuro de la Corea de Sol.
					
					 Las canciones mongolesas, que reflejan el patriotismo y el sentimiento del pueblo mongol, fueron ovacionadas por los huespedes. 
					
					Terminada la funcion, fue entregado a los ejecutantes un cesto de flores a nombre del mandatario mongol por el exito de funcion.

Tiene lugar acto de juramento de participantes en conferencia militar
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 28 en la explanada del Palacio del Sol Kumsusan el acto de juramento de los participantes en la 4a conferencia de jefes e instructores politicos de companias del Ejercito Popular de Corea para rendir el mas sublime homenaje a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y materializar cabalmente las tareas programaticas presentadas en el historico discurso del Comandante Supremo del EPC, Kim Jong Un, pronunciado en la misma conferencia. 
					Participaron aqui Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Chang Sop y otros cuadros directivos de los organismos de las fuerzas armadas y los comandantes del EPC. 
					
					Pronuncio un discurso el vicemariscal del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC. 
					
					El orador expuso la decision de convertir todas las companias del EPC como filas de flor y nata que defiendan a riesgo de la vida al Comandante Supremo. 
					
					Ahora todas las companias del EPC estan observando agudamente el movimiento imprudente de los enemigos que pretenden aplastar militarmente a la RPDC y destruiran en un instante los antros de agresion con golpes demoledores cuando el Comandante Supremo de la orden de ataque, enfatizo.
					
					En representacion de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas del EPC, los jefes e instructores politicos de companias hicieron uso de la palabra de juramento. 
					
					El jefe de compania, Ham Yong Bong, manifesto la decision de intensificar los ejercicios en el ambiente de combate de verdad para preparar a todos los militares como combatientes capaces de pelear uno contra cien enemigos y convertir su compania en la de tigres capaz de aniquilar primero los nidos de agresion. 
					
					El instructor politico de compania, Pak Hyon Su, destaco que si los piratas agresores invaden un poco de las sagradas aguas jurisdiccionales de la patria, todos los marineros los hundiran en el mar convirtiendose en torpedos. 
					
					El jefe de compania, Ri Chol Ho, apunto que su compania mantendra el estado de movilizacion perfecta como lo demanda la situacion creada e intensificara los ejercicios de vuelo para dar golpe demoledor a los enemigos con poderosos medios de ataque de nuestro estilo cuando el Comandante Supremo lo ordene.

articles.title: Delegado de RPDC expone la voluntad de lanzar otros satelites de usos practicos

Delegado de RPDC expone la voluntad de lanzar otros satelites de usos practicos
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- En la reunion del 4o comite del 68o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, sesionada el dia 23, el delegado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea expuso otra vez la voluntad de lanzar otros satelites de usos practicos, necesarios al desarrollo economico del pais y al mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida del pueblo. 
					Al hacer uso de la palabra durante el debate de la agenda "Cooperacion internacional en el uso del cosmos con fines pacificos", evaluo los esfuerzos de la Oficina Espacial de la ONU y el 4o comite por el desarrollo y aplicacion de las ciencias y tecnicas espaciales de todos los paises, en particular, por el aumento de la capacidad de desarrollo espacial de los paises en vias de desarrollo. 
					
					La RPDC tambien se concentra en el desarrollo espacial con fines pacificos de acuerdo con la tendencia mundial, dijo y continuo que el gobierno de la RPDC lanzo en varias ocasiones los satelites artificiales y tomo una serie de medidas para intensificar el desarrollo espacial. 
					
					Esta labor es el ejercicio del derecho independiente e intangible de un Estado soberano, reconocido por el derecho internacional, apunto y continuo:
					
					Sin embargo, las fuerzas hostiles insisten injustamente en que solo la RPDC no puede lanzar los satelites con fines pacificos. 
					
					En la actualidad, EE.UU. y algunos paises toleran tanto el lanzamiento de satelite como el disparo de misil balistico intercontinental por parte de los paises que les obedecen, pero impiden hasta el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos de los paises que no les agradan.
					
					Rechazamos rotunda y totalmente la "resolucion de sancion" fabricada por el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU cuestionando el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos de la RPDC y volvemos a aclarar que seguiremos lanzando los satelites de usos practicos, necesarios al desarrollo economico del pais y a la mejora de las condiciones de la vida del pueblo, garantizando la transparencia y pasando los tramites del derecho internacional.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, cumpliremos lo que nos toca hacer sumandonos a los esfuerzos internacionales por utilizar el cosmos como patrimonio comun de la humanidad.
